intro: Randia bellatula, commonly known as the velvetleaf or redroot. It is a flowering plant native to the Americas, particularly found in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species. Randia bellatula is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
